messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion  Farenheit 451
messages.msgSnippet: Farenheit 451 was about government control.  That was what i got out of it. The government took control of what the TV was saying and turned it into moronic
messages.messageBody:
Farenheit 451 was about government control. That was what i got out of it.
The government took control of what the TV was saying and turned it into
moronic stuff, so no one could think for themselves. And books were outlawed.
Freedom was removed. And the "people allowed it." Except for the few. (which I
would hope to be)

Stepheny




In a message dated 2/11/2004 6:08:56 AM Eastern Standard Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:


> And they always do. So Fahrenheitâ€™s not about censorship; it's about

> you anything but factoids. They tell you when Napoleon was born, but
> not who he was. So it doesnâ€™t matter about the dates, you shouldnâ€™t
> memorize dates, to hell with it. So we've moved into this period of
> history that I described in Fahrenheit 50 years ago."
